details.title: Diversity and the local body polls
details.content: This is the first local body election in TN in which 50% of the seats are reserved for women. By simply offering women the opportunity to occupy political space regardless of their background, diversity in representation is already guaranteed. Not enough has changed in the state. But some things certainly have. (READ THE FULL EDITORIAL HERE)

details.title: Women waiting to cast their votes
Senior citizens among early voters
details.content:
After eight years, Tamil Nadu Local body polls finally begins in 27 districts in the first phase.
Express photos by @ashokkumar_TNIE. @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/S3CbvnYQH4

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) December 27, 2019

details.title: Breakfast first, polling next
details.content:
A policeman tries to pacify an arguing voter when polling booth officials were out to have breakfast. "I am yet to have my breakfast, what about me?" asked the voter.

Voters wait to cast their votes at Siruvachur Government High School in #Perambalur as officials have gone to have their breakfast. @NewIndianXpress @xpresstn @collrpmb1 #LocalBodyElection #Tamilnadu pic.twitter.com/94q2DD4Rca

— Thiruselvam (@Thiruselvamts) December 27, 2019

details.title: Voter turnout at 9 AM
details.content:
• 12% polling in Dharmapuri district.
  • 12.03% polling in Salem district.
  • 6.8% polling in Sivaganga district.
  • 16% polling in Tiruchy district.
  • 7.47% polling in Madurai district.

details.title: Visually challenged voters queue up outside polling booth
10.4% voter turnout at 9 AM
details.content: Across Tamil Nadu, 10.4 per cent of votes have been polled till 9 AM in 27 districts where elections to rural local bodies are going on, says State Election Commissioner R Palaniswami.

details.title: Villagers boycott election at Harur block, Dharmapuri
Cash distribution inside polling booth at Tiruvallur
details.content:
Police personnel in Nemam village of Tiruvallur district say local politicians entered into voting booth 63,64 and 65 and were involved in cash distribution. This led to halt in voting for a brief time. #LocalBodyElections #TamilNadu @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/3XOD5K7bk6

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) December 27, 2019

details.title: Leprosy afflicted woman casts her vote
details.content: Vaanambal, a 85 year old leprosy afflicted woman casts her vote at the booth set up in Pudukkottai district rehabilitation centre, where she is an inmate.

details.title: Husband 'key' to wife's victory
details.content: To canvass for the independent candidate Selvi who contests in key symbol for Panchayat Ward Member post in Madurai, her husband Oor Kavalan wore a key garland and sought the people to vote for key symbol.

details.title: Minister Vijayabaskar's advise to officials
details.content: Transport minister Vijayabaskar, after casting his vote, advised the officials not to use the ear buds for inking the voter's finger and instead to use the prescribed brush.

details.title: State Election Commission on watch
details.content: Staff monitoring the polling process of local body elections, being held at 27 district in tamilnadu, at the office of state selection commission in Chennai on Friday. (Photo | EPS/P Jawahar)

details.content:
• 25.67% polling in Perambalur district.

  • 24.7% polling in Sivaganga district.
  • 13.65% polling in Tiruvannamalai district.

details.title: CM Edappadi K Palaniswami to cast his vote
details.content: Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami heading towards his Siluvampalayam village from Salem Airport to cast his vote.

details.title: 85-year-old arrives in Ambulance to cast her vote in Karur
24.08% voter turnout at 11 AM
details.content: Till 11 AM, the polling percentage in 27 districts stands at 24.08 per cent, says State Election Commission.

details.title: Traditional welcome to the voters!
details.content: Sticking to old tradition, the people of Therkku Aamur in Madurai district give betel leaves to the voters as they would be selecting the representative of the village. (Photo | EPS/k.k.sundar)

details.title: Tamil Nadu CM casts his vote
details.content: Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami along with his family members waited in queue and voted at Siluvampalayam village in Salem district.

details.title: Alleged booth capturing in Tiruvallur
details.content:
Press people argue with cops as they are not allowing journalists inside the booth in Papparambakkam panchayat in Tiruvallur. Cops are tight lipped about what happened inside. Visuals show ballot papers since morning were burnt by miscreants. #LocalBodyElections @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/5rfNDW5L7p

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) December 27, 2019

details.title: Violence in Tiruvallur
details.content: First reports of violence are coming as polling booth gets vandalised in at Papparambakkam Panchayat, Tiruvallur district.

details.title: CM Palaniswami goes back to ballot days
WATCH | Tamil Nadu votes in rural local body polls!
Police detain voters at Tiruvallur district
details.content:
Policy brutally dragged all the voters who staged a roko outside the polling booth at Papparambakkam Panchayat in Tiruvallaur and detained them in a bus. #LocalBodyElections #TamilNadu @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/NSwgXLDodk

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) December 27, 2019

details.content:
50.02% polling in Karur district

40.36 % polling in Cuddalore district 

43 % polling in Tirupur district

33.85 % polling in Tiruvannamalai district

details.title: Voter ID goof-up!
details.content: A 43-year-old woman was not allowed to vote as her voter ID has a photograph of a male. The woman, Amaravathi, alleges that she has been applying for correction for the 15 years and also has been voting with same ID in previous elections.

details.content:
Salem: 44.18%

Pudukkottai: 47.40%

Madurai: 45.91%

Thanjavur: 39%

Tiruvarur: 48%

Virudhunagar: 44%

Perambalur: 44.43%

details.title: Overall voter turnout - 1 PM Update
details.content: 42.47% votes have been polled in 27 districts in the Tamil Nadu rural Local Body Elections till 1 PM

details.title: WATCH | Panchayat president post auctioned, allege Dalit members of a Perambalur village settlement, boycott polls
details.content:
Dalit members in a settlemet at Perali village of #Perambalur district #Boycott election and hoisted #blackflags. They said the panchayat president (general) position was auctioned. @NewIndianXpress @xpresstn @collrpmb1 #LocalBodyElection #Tamilnadu pic.twitter.com/pek2ehEGed

— Thiruselvam (@Thiruselvamts) December 27, 2019

details.title: Two wards, one booth
details.content: Voters in Thiruvur Panchayat of Tiruvallur district complain of long wait to cast vote as voting for two wards has been kept in one booth.

details.title: Voters dropped off in AIADMK vehicles in Cuddalore Panchayat Union
details.content:
Several voters were dropped off at Edaiyurkuppam polling booth in Cuddalore panchayat union in vehicles arranged by AIADMK contesting candidate. As per election norms, this is an violation. #LocalBodyElection #Tamilnadu @NewIndianXpress @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/m4AwJIUCct

— Nirupa Sampath (@NirupaSampath) December 27, 2019

details.title: Polling ends for local body elections in 27 districts, those in queue issued tokens
details.content: Polling comes to an end for the first phase of elections to Rural Local Bodies in 27 districts; those who were in queue at 5 p.m have been issued tokens and they will be allowed vote.

details.title: Kathiripatti Panchayat polls for Village Panchayat President post rescheduled to 30 December
details.content:
• The polling for the president post in Kathripatti panchayat in Pappireddipatti block in Dharmapuri district has been rescheduled to 30.12.2019 after over 170 voters cast votes in wrong ballot sheets
  • Sub collector M Prathap said that the polling officer failed to notice the wrong ballots leading to the confusion
  • Nine people contested for the Village Panchayat president post but the ballot sheet only had five candidates names and symbols.
  • As the 170 casted votes cannot be cancelled, the elections have been rescheduled the election on 30.12.2019
  • Elections for Village Panchayat Ward Members, Panchayat Union Ward Members and District panchayat elections carried on unhindered

details.title: MP Thirumavalavan casts his vote at Anganur Panchayat Union Primary School in Ariyalur
Ballot box robbery attempt
details.content: An attempt to rob a ballot box from a polling booth was at Vemman village near Viralimalai in Pudukottai district was foiled.
